importantArticles.headline: With changing government administrations potentially becoming more favorable to the energy sector and with many of the stocks in that sector trading at a discount to historical valuations, midstream stocks are shaping up to be solid long-term investments right now.  Energy Transfer (NYSE: ET) owns one of the largest integrated midstream systems in the U.S., which also allows it to be one of the biggest energy arbitrageurs in the country.  The company is particularly well positioned in the Permian, the most prolific oil basin in the U.S. The Permian is also home to a lot of cheap associated natural gas, giving Energy Transfer a lot of opportunity around growing power needs for artificial intelligence (AI).
importantArticles.title: 4 Brilliant Midstream Stocks to Buy Now and Hold for the Long Term

importantArticles.headline: DALLAS, April 03, 2025--Energy Transfer LP (NYSE: ET) today announced that it plans to release earnings for the first quarter of 2025 on Tuesday, May 6, 2025, after the market closes.
importantArticles.title: Energy Transfer Announces First Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Earnings Call Timing

importantArticles.headline: Sunoco LP (NYSE: SUN) ("SUN" or the "Partnership") announced that it will release its first quarter 2025 financial and operating results before the market opens on Tuesday, May 6, 2025. Management will hold a conference call that same day at 9:00 a.m. Central Daylight Time (10:00 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time) to discuss SUN's results.
importantArticles.title: Sunoco LP Announces First Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Call Timing

importantArticles.headline: With changing government administrations potentially becoming more favorable to the energy sector and with many of the stocks in that sector trading at a discount to historical valuations, midstream stocks are shaping up to be solid long-term investments right now.  Energy Transfer (NYSE: ET) owns one of the largest integrated midstream systems in the U.S., which also allows it to be one of the biggest energy arbitrageurs in the country.  The company is particularly well positioned in the Permian, the most prolific oil basin in the U.S. The Permian is also home to a lot of cheap associated natural gas, giving Energy Transfer a lot of opportunity around growing power needs for artificial intelligence (AI).
importantArticles.title: 4 Brilliant Midstream Stocks to Buy Now and Hold for the Long Term

importantArticles.headline: Energy Transfer (NYSE: ET) is the kind of business that an income investor would be attracted to.  Its midstream assets produce reliable, fee-driven cash flows that help support a large and growing distribution.  The distribution yield is a lofty 6.8%.
importantArticles.title: Energy Transfer: Buy, Sell, or Hold?

importantArticles.headline: March winds bring April showers.  Seriously, there are several great ultra-high-yield dividend stocks to buy in April.  Ares Capital (NASDAQ: ARCC) offers such a high dividend yield, at 8.68%, that you might wonder if it's sustainable.
importantArticles.title: 3 Ultra-High-Yield Dividend Stocks to Buy in April

importantArticles.headline: The stock market sell-off is intensifying, with the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) down 4.8% in the first three months of the year compared to an over 10% tumble in the Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC).  Meanwhile, Energy Transfer (NYSE: ET), Dominion Energy (NYSE: D), and Nike (NYSE: NKE) provide passive income regardless of the stock market's performance.  Motley Fool contributors were asked to offer some details on why all five of these industry-leading companies are built to last and are worth buying and holding even if the stock market goes through a prolonged downturn.
importantArticles.title: 5 Top Stocks to Buy in April

importantArticles.headline: Energy Transfer LP (ET) closed at $18.73 in the latest trading session, marking a +0.75% move from the prior day.
